alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 01 at 2:54PM CDT until April 05 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE, THE SOUTH PLAINS, AND THE ROLLING PLAINS... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING THROUGH LATE TUESDAY NIGHT FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE FAR SOUTHERN TEXAS PANHANDLE, THE SOUTH PLAINS, AND THE ROLLING PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Fire Weather Watch, which is in effect from Monday morning through Monday evening. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued from Tuesday morning through late Tuesday night. * Timing...Noon Monday until 12 AM on Tuesday, and 6 AM Tuesday until 12 AM on Wednesday. * Wind...Westerly winds 25 to 35 mph on Monday,and greater than 40 mph on Tuesday. * Humidity...As low as 6 percent on Sunday, as low as 4 percent on Monday and Tuesday. * Fuels...Critically dry on Sunday and Extremely dry on Monday and Tuesday. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.

area.areaDesc: Childress; Cottle; Dickens; Hall; Kent; King; Motley; Stonewall
